com.galois.hacrypto.req.input

Class LengthInput

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.galois.hacrypto.req.input.LengthInput
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Input

    public class LengthInput
extends java.lang.Object
implements Input
    Input that gives the length of another input
    Author:
    jdodds

    • Constructor Detail

      • LengthInput

        public LengthInput(java.lang.String name,
           int lengthof,
           Req req,
           java.lang.String units)
        Parameters:
        name - Name of this input. Will appear before the value of the input in the req string
        lengthof - number of the input that this input gives the length of
        req - the parent req. This is the req that the lengthof argument points into
        units - can be byte or bytes. Any other value will result in the length being printed in bits

    • Method Detail

      • hasNextInput

        public boolean hasNextInput()
        Specified by:
        hasNextInput in interface Input
        Returns:
        whether or not this Input has more values. Some inputs always have more values

      • getInputLength

        public InputLength getInputLength()
        Specified by:
        getInputLength in interface Input
        Returns:
        the length corresponding to this input. May be null for objects that print integers instead of byte arrays

      • toReqString

        public java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,byte[]> toReqString()
        Description copied from interface: Input
        creates a string of the form "name = value" for the next input. This advances the input: the next input might be different
        Specified by:
        toReqString in interface Input
        Returns:
        A pair of the req string and the byte array value of the input if it has one. The byte array may be empty of null, an empty representation, or a byte array representation of an integer
